page.title: 14BIRDLIFE IN BALDERTON
page.content: I study birds as a hobby and these are the results of a survey I did in the local area. I discovered 16 species in the southern part of the village. Sparrows, mainly house sparrows, were observed in the greatest numbers and like the frequently seen swifts, swallows and house martins,they were on and above both old and new housing areas. Blackbirds, song thrushes, starlings, doves and pigeons were also seen frequently.The gardens and hedges seem to attract blue tits, great tits finches,sparrows and robins. Carrion crows were seen feeding near the A.1. which skirts the area, whilst a kestrel hovered above.
